Name: Aldo Cafiero Holding Srl - Cafiero Srl
Company description: La Studio Promozionali nasce nel 1980, nel Bellunese, creata da Guido Cafiero, la moglie Ester Baldi, e il figlio Aldo Cafiero, opera nello studio e progettazione del packaging per la gioielleria e bigiotteria di alta gamma. Dal 1996 si concentra sulla produzione degli astucci per occhiali e accessori di occhialeria, brevettando molti dei prodotti che oggi risultano tra i pi√π richiesti dal mercato; nello stesso anno avvia una produzione nella Repubblica Ceca. Nel 2003 avviene un processo di rebranding con il passaggio di consegne alla seconda generazione; il figlio Aldo Cafiero,  trasforma Studio Promozionali, in Cafiero Srl, trasferisce la produzione in un nuovo e moderno stabilimento di Limana, e crea Ricerca&Sviluppo, divisione dedicata alla guida tecnica e al futuro dei nuovi prodotti. Il settore occhialeria per Cafiero srl rappresenta il 60% del suo volume d‚Äôaffari e la vede collaborare con alcune tra le pi√π importanti realt√† produttive dell'occhialeria come Luxottica, Safilo, De Rigo, Marcolin, Silhouette; permettendo all'Azienda Cafiero di creare e produrre per i pi√π quotati marchi internazionali della moda. Dal 2009 una nuova entit√† produttiva nel Guangdong, a sud della Cina, a totale capitale italiano, caso definito raro. Nel 2010 √® inserita I.E.S. di Hong Kong Societ√† di Trading che gestisce anche la logistica e i trasporti in l'Oriente e per Europa, U.S.A., Medio Oriente, Oceania. La sede in Italia, con Ricerca&Sviluppo, ha fatto e continua a fare importanti investimenti nella ricerca per offrire il meglio in fatto di design e materiali ecocompatibili. Nel 2011 nasce la nuova linea di packaging per Food and Beverage con un occhio di riguardo al mondo vino (www.cafierowinepack.com), prodotti che si presentano sul mercato con un design innovativo e raffinato, che strizza l'occhio al mercato delle borse di tendenza. Nel 2014 viene costituita la Aldo Cafiero Holding srl, che sta lavorando appassionatamente alla realizzazione di una nuova linea di alta moda.

Name: Sea2see Eyewear
HQ Location: Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona, 12 Passeig De Manuel Girona, 08034
Company description: Plastic in our oceans is one of the most important environmental issues. Sea2See, through its foundation, aims to collect and recycle marine plastic to create seastainable eyewear frames and watches. At Sea2See, we believe in making positive waves. We give value to waste to create a sustainable and scalable solution that reduces marine plastic, raises public awareness, and improves the lives of marginalised coastal communities living in biodiversity hotspots of developing countries. The plastic we collect from the most polluted beaches in Africa (Ghana) is sent to Italy for the handmade production of our glasses and sunglasses and to Switzerland to produce our watches. 1 product sold = 1 kg marine plastic recycled ‚ôªÔ∏è Follow us on Instagram @sea2see_legacy and @sea2see_foundation https://www.sea2seefoundation.org

Name: UNIQBROW

Using innovative QUIROFLEX smart material, our glasses are all terrain travel companions.  When you travel, everything you carry has a purpose. Our sunglasses are extremely lightweight (no nose marks!), flexible, reinforced with TR-90, resistant to extreme temperatures, easy to clean, and with scratch resistant polarized lenses.   Our glasses have traveled to 72 countries, where will you take them? UNIQBROW is made in Barcelona, a hub for travel, tourism, design, and culture. 14.5 million people visit our city each year. From our first store we have met people from dozens of countries. UNIQBROW glasses are made for the most extreme adventure, or the most relaxed strolls, our glasses can handle absolutely anything.   You can rest easy knowing that even if you push to hard and something breaks our frames are guaranteed for life. Just send us an email to info@uniqbrow.com and we will take care of you!

Name: GLASSING
HQ Location: Italy, Lombardy, Gravellona Lomellina, 23 Via Xx Settembre, 27020
Company description: Glassing is nearly born for fun in Ibiza during summer 2010, from an idea of two young Italian guys, Alessandro Forte and Stefano Ottone.  The two lifelong friends land on the island provided only with their initiative, creativity and the typical recklessness of their age. Overwhelmed by Ibiza's beauty, music and hippie style they quickly decide to stay there and open a store selling vintage glasses, their great passion. From the store to a real brand it's a short step. They soon choose to dare producing thousands of multi-colored sunglasses, with the brilliant idea to sell them through automatic distributors inside of clubs. The success is enthusiastic, that summer Glassing sells only on the island more than 20.000 glasses, crowding all the beaches and the discos. From then on Alessandro and Stefano show to grow up, collection after collection, as designers but also as entrepeneurs. They quickly emerge for their will to experiment and to create cutting edge glasses, taking advange of the Italian expertise. They focus on innovative materials often combined in unusual ways, believe in young designers and their courage, while trust the knowledge of the best Italian factories for the production and for the uniqueness of the handmade manufacture.  The brand is currently distributed in more than 1500 selected optical stores in the world and in some luxury boutiques and department stores such as Saks Fifth Avenue, Neiman Marcus, Holt Renfrew, Excelsior, Galeries LaFayette, Twist.   Glassing has also four flagship stores in Italy (Milan, Portofino, Taormina and Capri), an outlet and a Yacht Store, a real yacht completely customized according to the brand‚Äôs image and designated to be a shop, the first floating optical store ever.  In 2016 more openings are expected out of Italy, in fact Glassing is launching a series of pop-up stores in Dubai, in advance of the flagship store officially opening in October 2016, and is planning its own international retail network.

Name: Lunet Eyewear
Company description: Lunet is bringing transparency to the table, one pair of glasses at a time. We‚Äôve been wearing glasses for what seems like forever, but it hasn't always been a joyride. We didn't want to blend in with everyone else, wearing the same frames. The eyewear industry's business model was just weighing us down. So, we decided to do things differently. We got rid of all the unnecessary steps  and focused on what truly matters. We design the frames ourselves and work directly with the manufacturers to bring those designs to life. We sell our glasses exclusively in our stores and online on our website.  We deliver them straight to you. No middlemen, no extra costs.  And here's the best part: our glasses are available at a fixed price. Good vision doesn't have to cost a fortune. Everyone should be able to buy quality eyewear at affordable prices.

Name: Glass + Glam
Company description: A new icon in the making, and sporting a contemporary aesthetic, Glam+Glass ¬Æ is set to revolutionize the world of optics and more specifically that of fashion addicts who collect fun, colourful and assertive spectacle frames. Mod. 52 was designed mainly by observing the behaviour and lifestyle of these users, responding to their functional and stylistic expectations, and it makes a strong statement from the outset.  Offering a fine-tuned image of iconic visual references, this model nevertheless asserts its own visual identity and lays the foundations for the brand's DNA; a stylish but also technical DNA, e.g. by complying effectively with every standard of robustness and eye protection. Using an innovative technological process, and specific choice of material, the frame is both rigid and structural and yet soft and flexible in use, allowing it to be converted instantly from sunglasses into prescription spectacles. The tinted lenses are easily detached, without the need for any tools; they unclip and can then be replaced as required with corrective lenses or other tinted lenses in the Glass+Glam range.  Ideally suited to everyday use, whether urban, sports or relaxation, the frame is moulded from a single piece, with no joints, screws or hinges, and with no additional parts that might come off. The design of the glasses addresses every detail of ergonomic comfort, fully exploiting the opportunities offered by the production process. The silicone developed to make Mod. 52 is innovative, has a natural and sensual feel and is pleasant to the touch; it is specially treated to prevent any allergic reaction. It makes for an extremely light frame that is ultra-flexible without sacrificing comfort or strength. It is precisely this relative flexibility of the material that prevents the glasses being crushed. Which is great news for restless sporting types or for fashionistas who use their glasses as a stress ball or a headband...

Name: Emilio Scolari 1922
Company description: ENGLISH It was the first post-war period when, in 1922, the leather goods factory was born in Cerva sreet, just behind the Duomo of Milan. It was the Scolari familiar business. In 1960, he took up the reins of the leather factory and he addressed it to the production of sample cases, which was a very requested product at the time (his own signature became the symbol of the firm). In 1991, he dedicated himself to the production of writing tools: fountain pens, rollers and pencils and, some of them were covered in leather.  In 2005 Emilio Scolari passed on the baton to his pupil, Fabio Orzieri, who brought his own experience and his own taste to the production. He created a line of cigars for connoisseurs, the ES1922s. In  2006 he invented a line of glasant eyewear, glasses and sunglasses, made precious by Swarovsky crystal beads and pearls. ITALIANO √à il primo dopoguerra quando nel 1922 in via Cerva 1 a due passi dal Duomo di Milano, nacque la pelletteria a conduzione famigliare degli Scolari. nel 1958 Emilio fonda la Emilio Scolari 1922 dedicata alla produzione di accessori moda. Nel 1949 la maison crea la famosa borsa Lady R., riscuotendo un grande successo. Nel 1955 realizza la prima coppia di gemelli in oro e coccodrillo. Nel 1985, firma la sua prima collezione di cronografi, dal 1991 in poi, si dedica agli strumenti da scrittura: stilografiche, roller e mine.  Nel 2006 Emilio Scolari entra nel mondo dell‚Äôeyewear e firma una piccola collezione di occhiali, da vista e da sole, con una particolarit√† unica: le montature sono decorate (brevetto internazionale) con preziosi cristalli e perle Swarovski.

Damit wollen wir ganz bewusst auf den Kreislauf der Herstellung einer Tasche aufmerksam machen und zeigen, dass wir das Tier, das Lebewesen, die Natur huldigen und ihm einen weiteren Sinn in der lebenslangen Dienlichkeit als st√§ndiger Begleiter mit individuellem Charakter geben. Dem ist hinzuzuf√ºgen, dass das verwendete Leder nur aus der Nebenverwertung der Fleischindustrie stammt und kein Tier zur Lederherstellung get√∂tet wurde.

Name: Bluwinx
Company description: After spending over 30 years studying sleep, we know how important a good night‚Äôs rest is for your brain and body to function properly. We‚Äôre also aware of the nature of modern work - spending an average of 9 hours a day in front of digital screens that emit blue light. Studies show that overexposure to blue light disrupts our sleep cycle and prevents us from falling asleep at night.  With 40% of Americans getting less than the recommended amount of sleep each night, we knew we had to intervene. That‚Äôs when the idea for bluwinx was born. We developed a simple solution for protecting your eyes without making any lifestyle changes. All bluwinx glasses are made to wear during daytime and nighttime, and can be fit with your prescription, so there‚Äôs no need for two pairs of frames.  The best part is, they look just like regular eyeglasses - no amber tint! Each of our eyeglasses is specially manufactured in an ophthalmic lab in Ohio, USA. They are made with KODAK Total Blue¬Æ Lens technology which: - filters up to 80% of the High Energy Visible (HEV) Blue Light - offers 100% UV protection - has anti-reflective coating on the front and back - has no amber tint - has a superhydrophobic layer which makes them easy-to-clean bluwinx blue light blocking glasses deliver the KODAK Total Blue¬Æ Lens technology, offering unsurpassed filtration of the harmful blue-violet light. Enjoy less harmful screen time and catch quality Zzzs with bluwinx - because you have the right to a good night‚Äôs sleep.

Name: Edony
HQ Location: Italy, Lombardy, Milan, 47 Corso Di Porta Vittoria, 20122

Name: KARAKASSIS OPTICS
Company description: High quality eyewear, optometry services

Name: GSM CRYSTAL EMOTION
Company description: GSM was founded in Carpi in the early 90s by Giuliano Rossi with his sons Massimiliano and Stefano, who stubbornly wanted to specialize in the production of automatic machines for applying rhinestones, crystals and thermoadhesive cabochons. The goal is to satisfy the market demand for the distribution of crystals to be used in the creation of fashion garments and accessories. Thanks to dedication, in search of perfection and innovation, GSM crystals and rhinestones are now used in various fields: clothing, footwear, fashion accessories, eyewear, jewelry and furniture. Today GSM can offer a highly technological structure, based on inventions and developments of machinery designed internally and manufactured by ourselves to create economically and industrially competitive products and processes of great productivity. Chosen by important names in the fashion system for their high quality, these perfect crystals adorn admirable objects of desire all over the world. GSM represents the best in the Crystal Work Out and the realization of products for the industries of the sector.

Name: DIESSE Eyewear
HQ Location: Italy, Veneto, Domegge Di Cadore, 1 Via Vittorio Veneto, 32040

Name: Mondelliani Di Mondello Roma Srl
Company description: Mondello Roma srl is dedicated to the art of eyewear, where craftsmanship and innovation shape both vision and identity. Our multibrand retail space, Mondelliani, is a destination in the heart of Rome, offering both crafted and curated exceptional eyewear alongside accessories. Soprattutto, our signature line, merges artisanal expertise with technological precision to create timeless designs. With Ottovolante, we bring a refined yet playful approach to reading glasses, adding character to every glance.

Name: Panaidis Eyewear Boutique
Company description: Panaidis Eyewear Boutique operates for more than four decades, having now 40 modern stores in the major shopping areas of Athens, 9 stores on the islands of Santorini, Mykonos, Rhodes, Lemnos, Corfu, Kos, Paros, Crete and 1 store in Nicosia Cyprus. Drawing on our wealth of design knowledge, we can match the personality of any client. Our customers greatly value our attention to detail and aesthetic sensibility, our sense of poise and balance. We have iconic and innovative frames for every look, from elegant sophistication to flamboyant chic. Our collections are sourced from leading designers around the world.

Company description: Vardavas Optics was founded in 1935 and has been providing ever since eye products and unique, high - quality services.  We are based in the heart of Athens (Kolonaki area) offering a wide variety of sunglasses, optical frames, contact lenses and other optical accessories in order to satisfy even the most demanding customers.  Our strong assets and competitive advantages are: - Direct cooperation with 'Diavgia Ophthalmology Center" (16, Akadimias str, 4th floor, 10671, Kolonaki) combines your eyewear purchases with a complete eye check-up and other diagnostic services in one single visit.  - Expertise in multifocal (progressive) lenses for those who have presvyopia and desire an easy life by using one single pair of optical frames instead of 3!  - Specilisation in selecting the most appropriate contact lenses. - Deep knowledge, experience and scientific approach of the total subject regarding the vision for more than 80 years, in order to help you choose the most appropriate eye products for yourself and your lifestyle. - Love for our job and our customers because we understand that we all have different appearance and desires that make us uniquely beautiful as well as we trully believe the moto 'Right Glasses = Nice Glasses'.  We are more than happy to offer you our products and provide you our services. We are looking forward to meeting you soon!  The Vardavas Optics Team

Name: VANNI S.r.l. Societ√† Benefit
HQ Location: Italy, Piedmont, Turin, 46 Bis Via G. Collegno, 10133
Company description: Born in Turin 30 years ago, the company which has established itself in the world of creative eyewear design with its two labels VANNI and DERAPAGE takes on the form of a ‚ÄúBenefit Corporation‚Äù, the result of a journey that has lasted 8 months, changing its denomination in VANNI S.r.l. Societ√† Benefit. This corporate typology (introduced in Italy with the law no. 208/2015,) applies to the companies that pursue objectives of common good- beyond those of profit- in their corporate purpose.  In particular, the pillars of VANNI‚Äôs imminent evolution will be built on four objectives, specified in the new statute: 1) to continue to bring quality products and services to the market 2) to improve the environmental impact of the product and of the processes involved, contributing to a business culture in the sector 3) to engage in the betterment of the environment and of the working conditions therewithin, placing people at the center 4) to contribute to the positive economic outcome of acting on its territory   Equipped with an internal style center, VANNI guarantees a 100% Made in Italy production: the glasses are made from Italian components and raw materials, produced in Italian factories, and distributed in over 40 countries around the world.

Name: Miller & Marc
HQ Location: Spain, Madrid, Madrid, 2 Corredera Alta De San Pablo, 28004
Company description: Miller & Marc is a lifestyle eyewear brand with an ambitious objective: to offer high-quality eyewear at affordable prices while making a positive social impact.

Name: NETOPTIC S.A.
Company description: Netoptic ‚Äì initially, this is the story of a family. Netoptic is also the story of a remarkable entrepreneurial adventure facilitating the creation of the Kinto, Malt, Akarti and Top Vision brands.  And finally, Netoptic is the chronicle of a passion. A passion that prompted Celso Viejo to create fashionable, comfortable glasses that anyone can wear ‚Äì fine, light spectacles as fashion accessories, designed to the needs and desires of the customers.  A passion that he passed on to his daughter Johanna, who has totally assumed and embraced the DNA of the company and its brands. KINTO Originating in 1978 from the idea of creating unforgettable eyewear, over the years Kinto has developed into a brand with a strong personality and fine, ergonomic shapes. Kinto appropriates major trends and legendary designs to make them affordable. Travel avec Kinto!  https://www.facebook.com/Kinto.eyewear https://instagram.com/kinto_eyewear https://twitter.com/Kinto_Eyewear MALT The Malt collection is based on the concept of expressive spectacle frames for men only. The meticulous care and attention taken during the production process result in very high-quality frames. https://www.facebook.com/malt.eyewear AKARTI We use all our wealth of experience as eyewear manufacturers for helping those who need strong corrections: broad nose bridge, distinctive end pieces, small sizes,‚Ä¶ All parts and aspects are examined to optimize the assembly process for complex optical corrections.  TOP VISION Netoptic has been producing cleaning agents for spectacle lenses and frames since the 1970s. The formula has gone through constant further development over the years so that now in 2016 we offer a top quality product. Despite its powerful grease-removing properties, it leaves the surface finish intact, while being resistant and lightly perfumed. It leaves a protective film on the lenses and frame.

Name: Regliss
Company description: Brand di abbigliamento e accessori Italiano nato a Gennaio 2013 (regliss.it). L‚Äôapproccio estremamente dinamico ha permesso l‚Äôampliamento dei prodotti all'interno di rivenditori tra le varie regioni Italiane, Spagnole, Francesi e Portoghesi. Ad oggi Regliss propone prodotti per uomo e donna come: abbigliamento, orologi in acciaio, legno, acetato e silicone (sia economici, sia di alta gamma luxury), bracciali in acciaio certificato Aisi 304, occhiali da sole in acetato e legno, occhiali da vista in acetato, legno, silicone, lenti da vista personalizzate con diottria del cliente sia per montatura Regliss, sia per montatura fornita dal cliente (le lenti sono Made In Italy, rispettando tutte le direttive europee 93/42 EEC sui dispositivi medici identificate con il marchio CE soddisfando inoltre gli standard europei EN ISO 14889 e EN ISO 8980 essendo realizzate all'interno di laboratori sterili da tecnici specializzati optometristi altamente qualificati e competenti), scarpe per il tempo libero, borse, pochette e portafogli.

Name: Cohete Distribution
Company description: Since 2004, Cohete Distribution has led the way in surfboard and SUP board manufacturing in Greece, with a vision to share its products globally. Specializing in crafting high-quality boards, we've expanded our reach to twelve countries. Additionally, as representatives of renowned brands like Red Bull Spect Eyewear, O'Neill, Dakine, Foamlide ,Zebras & Libras and more, we're committed to providing top-tier gear for sea and snow sports enthusiasts worldwide

Name: Gobi Amsterdam
Company description: Our collection is build upon inspiration from nature. Organically grown from the colors and shapes unfolding beyond us. Our fashion forward yet timeless designs are a translation of a durable and lasting product. A search for new materials leads to a surprising and evolving collection every season. The heart of GOBI is reflected in the materialization of the glasses. We use different types of coloring, lenses and finishing for our sunglasses. All our models come in a brush, deep matte or high polished finish and are handcrafted in a 25 step process that takes over more than 2,5 months. Using the best, hand-selected bio acetates, lenses and hinges, GOBI can stand the test of time. Website: www.gobi-amsterdam.com

Name: Iwood Occhiali
HQ Location: Italy, Sicily, Gela, 33 Via Porta Vittoria, 93012
Company description: iwood nasce con l‚Äôobiettivo di poter dare la possibilit√† di scegliere: a chi vuole distinguersi dalla massa, a chi vuole un tocco di eleganza, a chi desidera sentirsi unico e con uno stile ricercato. Gli occhiali da sole in Bamboo con lenti polarizzate contribuiscono a raggiungere il livello adatto ad ogni tipo di occasione.

Name: Ottica Gaetano Spoto
HQ Location: Italy, Sicily, Ragusa, 20 Via Fosso Tantillo, 97015
Company description: Ottica Gaetano Spoto a Modica √® un centro ottico all‚Äôavanguardia, considerato come punto di riferimento per una clientela che pone la fiducia e l‚Äôattenzione alle proprie necessit√† come fattori principali nel rapporto cliente-ottico; all‚Äôinterno lavorano professionisti orgogliosi di appartenere alla propria azienda e riconosciuti per la loro indiscussa professionalit√† e per la capacit√† di stare al fianco dei clienti.  Infatti, Gaetano Spoto, forte dei princ√¨pi e dei valori etici e professionali trasmessi dalle tre generazioni che lo hanno preceduto, ha focalizzato la propria attenzione non sulla vendita degli occhiali fine a se stessa, bens√¨ sulla possibilit√† di far sperimentare ai propri clienti il BENESSERE VISIVO.  √à anche per questo motivo che ZEISS, uno dei leader mondiali nel campo dell‚Äôottica di precisione e dell‚Äôinnovazione tecnologica, dopo anni di proficua collaborazione ha deciso di rafforzare il sodalizio concedendo ad ottica Gaetano Spoto di diventare uno ZEISS VISION STORE.

Name: EveryWear Shop
Company description: Welkom bij onze reis! Bij EveryWear, ligt onze focus op het innoveren binnen de optiek industrie door de ontwikkeling van de meest geavanceerde vervuilingsvrije zonnebrillen. Ons doel? Een productlijn die perfect aansluit bij elke levensstijl en elk avontuur. We zijn ons bewust van de uitdagingen in onze branche, met name het feit dat maar liefst 80% van het acetaat dat gebruikt wordt voor monturen, verspild wordt. Daarom hebben wij ons tot doel gesteld om deze verspilling tegen te gaan.  Onze revolutionaire benadering maakt gebruik van 3D-printtechnologie√´n op basis van plantaardige materialen. Dit stelt ons in staat om de productieketen volledig transparant te maken en onze ecologische voetafdruk drastisch te verminderen. In samenwerking met optiekzaken willen we een beweging op gang brengen voor meer bewustwording en duurzaamheid binnen de optiekwereld. Sluit aan en maak deel uit van onze missie!

Name: Essedue Sunglasses
HQ Location: Italy, Campania, Ariano Irpino, 87 Via Serra, 83031
Company description: The philosopher Heraclitus starts from it to talk about life: Panta Rhei, ‚Äúeverything flows‚Äù, to say that ‚Äúeverything moves and nothing stands still‚Äù; it compares the existence to the flow of a river, he adds that ‚Äúyou could not enter twice in the same river‚Äù. Our life is a continuous becoming, constantly changing, nothing stands still. It is important to anticipate the change, foresee it and try to rule it. For some months now I have been meditating on this concept. Change, mutation, transformation, metamorphosis. Of course, I was referring it to my very own passion: the design of glasses and its possibilities for change and transformation. Our story has started with some distinctive and characterizing features that have allowed Essedue to burst into the market of independent brands. Strong of this identity, I felt that the river under my feet was flowing faster and faster and I said to myself: I want to mark a new path to follow the change and transformation. Hence the idea of metamorphosis (#Metamorphosis) was born. The change has not simply happened in the design and manufacture but also in the overall life of the Essedue brand; in the administration, production and communication. Therefore, Essedue is transforming and highlighting its identity. The collection we present has new colors, different fronts and temples which do not sacrifice either design, or comfort. Working hard we have created a collection that is accessible to everyone. Right from the concept of accessibility another leitmotif is born: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Your Right‚Äù (#itsYourRight). Browsing this visual magazine you will be able to perceive the Essedue identity with a metaphorical name that refers to the eyewear: Mask. The turning point for us is the focus on a message that is extra-ordinary, on artistic and creative collaborations that - realized by Peppe Tortora, creative director of Essedue - stimulate curiosity, throw an irreverent and unconventional message.

Name: Kyme Eyewear
HQ Location: Italy, Campania, Frigento, Localit√† Taverna Di Annibale, 83040
Company description: Kyme is an Italian eyewear brand of Essequadro Group, that produces optical and sunglasses completely handmade in Italy. Since 2013 it distributes his frames all over the world, especially in Italy, France, Greece, Israel, Spain and Usa. For business inquiries customerservice@kymesunglasses.com Kyme was born from an inspiration, from a creative impulse and a great passion. As a continuous flow, it comes with the power of a wave, to disrupt the cliches and to create a new soul in the eyewear‚Äôs world. Kyme is made a reality by the people who share their days and thoughts by interacting with each other, each in their own field, with skill and passion. Young but experienced, KYME collaborators provide their customers and suppliers with availability, flexibility and great listening skills. Attentive to trends but out of the patterns, sensitive and lively, they are the heart of the company, an engine for constant innovation. All Kyme glasses are entirely made in Italy at the Essequadro's factory: the wisdom and experience of optician artisans is put to the service of the genius and creativity of southern Italy. And it‚Äôs so that a dream is realized: from southern creative genius come out beautiful glasses, by the expert hand of the northern craftsmen comes out a well-made and proportioned structure, from the materials finally, come out the quality of the product.  Since 2013, the commitment and passion shown by the whole team has led to reaching the company‚Äôs economic goals. The results are clearly seen in the growth of turnover and by the increasing ability of developing business markets internationally outside of Italy, where the brand was born and finds its root. KYME is out to conquer the world, through a wide and transversal offer. Throughout the years, many optical styles have progressively joined the sun collection.

Name: JPLUS
HQ Location: Italy, Veneto, Padova, 49/51 Via San Pietro, 35139
Company description: JPLUS is an indipendent italian eyewear brand, born of the idea of Alessandro Martire and inspired to the Beat Generation.  It always distinguished itself by the use of colour and a forefront stylistic research. ABOUT US JPLUS is an indipendent brand founded in 2009 in Italy  who produces contemporary frames.  JPLUS has immediately stood out for the coloured stroke on the front which recalls the J shape. THE STORY Inspired by the Jack Kerouac's thought on the Beat generation, from which the logo was born, JPLUS presented its first collection as a tribute to 3 prominent figures of that historical movement: Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin and John Lennon. Starting from a classic design, JPLUS recovered from the past the most iconic shapes as a starting point to build a collection more and more anticulated and complex. Models as the Jimi's or the Janis' keep being a source of inspiration and of stylistic continuity. MISSION Since its birth, JPLUS' goal has been to develop and product high quality eyewear, entirely made in Italy at a democratic price. Alessandro Martire explains his beginning thought that brought him to conceive the brand: ‚Äùtalking with many appassionate friends like me and observing the eyewear market, I felt some kind of disinterestedness in looking for sunglasses in the usual distribution channels. The research was moved to particular vintage markets or to the concept stores who kept making stylistic research. A clear sign of sickness towards the companies who offer boring products at unjustified prices. From this situation, the idea to have a more ‚Äúsocial‚Äù contact with people took shape, presenting a collection with a strong identity directly to the final public, during events or parties as ‚ÄúSalone del Mobile‚Äù in Milan or the Venice Film Festival, where people were able to buy directly our product. In this way, we got the possibility to have a clear view about what we were doing and the emotions that we could raise. This direct contact with our public has always been written in our DNA and will always stay alive, though our distributions have been extended at the whole commercial territory‚Äù. COLLABORATIONS JPLUS developed for two years a collaboration with Costume National, a Milanese brand considered as one of the fathers of minimalism.

Company description: Marcolin is a leading global eyewear company founded in 1961 in the Veneto eyewear district of Italy. With over 60 years of experience, Marcolin specializes in designing, producing, and distributing high-quality eyewear for some of the most prestigious brands in the industry, including TOM FORD, ZEGNA, and ic! berlin. The company's mission is to generate and deliver value in the eyewear sector by listening to customers and continuously improving product quality and service. Marcolin envisions itself as the best partner in the global eyewear market, focusing on a balanced and complementary brand portfolio that caters to diverse consumer needs. The company is committed to sustainability, integrating environmental, social, and governance (ESG) principles into its operations while fostering long-term partnerships with clients and suppliers. Marcolin serves a diverse clientele, ranging from luxury brands like GUESS and Tod's to diffusion brands such as Skechers, targeting a wide spectrum of consumers from fashion-forward millennials to sophisticated adults seeking premium eyewear.  With a strong emphasis on craftsmanship and innovation, Marcolin combines artisanal techniques with advanced technology to maintain its leadership position in the industry. The company operates in over 125 countries, supported by a robust network of subsidiaries and distribution partners, and employs approximately 2,000 people. Marcolin actively engages with its clients through events like the Summer Buying Days, showcasing new collections and gathering feedback to enhance its offerings. By investing in expanding its brand portfolio and enhancing its market presence, particularly in high-potential regions like Asia, Marcolin aims to adapt to evolving market trends and consumer preferences while delivering exceptional products that resonate with its target audience.

Company description: Since 1954, NANNINI designs, produces and distributes sunglasses and eyewear frames both from cellulose acetate and from injected, and reading glasses. Initially specialized in the production of motorcycle goggles, the company soon began to establish itself in the Italian and international eyewear market, proving its strong entrepreneurial spirit.  In 2008, a new corporate structure reshaped the company's future, leading to a true evolution of the business. With a constant eye on its roots and on the tradition of Italian expertise, the new managerial setup relaunched Nannini's corporate strategy, placing the creative process and production integration at the centre of its project. The management of an entirely in-house, Made in Italy production has consolidated the company's creative and productive know-how year after year, resulting from passion, craftsmanship, and attention to detail. Today, Nannini owns four proprietary brands (Giorgio Nannini, Common Ground, Onirico e Nannini Eyecare), for which it internally handles creative design, technical planning, and production. The company also has a production atelier dedicated to the design and creation of private label collections.

Name: Ray-Ban
Company description: Ray-Ban is a renowned eyewear brand that specializes in designing and manufacturing high-quality sunglasses and optical frames, celebrated for its iconic styles such as the Wayfarer and Aviator. Established in 1937, the company is dedicated to providing stylish and functional eyewear that enhances personal expression while ensuring optimal eye protection from harmful UV rays. Ray-Ban's mission is to blend fashion with functionality, appealing to a diverse clientele that includes fashion enthusiasts, celebrities, and everyday consumers seeking premium eyewear solutions. The brand's vision focuses on continuous innovation in design and technology, maintaining its legacy of authenticity and style. Ray-Ban's target market spans multiple demographics and regions, including North America, Europe, and Asia, attracting a wide range of consumers from young adults to professionals. The company partners with various retailers and operates its own stores globally, ensuring accessibility to its products. In addition to traditional eyewear, Ray-Ban has embraced technological advancements, exemplified by the introduction of the Ray-Ban Meta glasses, which integrate features like voice commands and connectivity with mobile applications for a seamless user experience. With a commitment to sustainability, Ray-Ban continues to evolve its product offerings by incorporating biobased materials into its eyewear collections. The brand collaborates with partners in both the fashion and technology sectors, enhancing its product range and expanding its reach in the digital space. Through its innovative approach and dedication to quality, Ray-Ban remains at the forefront of the eyewear industry, empowering individuals to express their unique identities through its iconic products.

Name: VISTALEC
Company description: VISTALEC is a brand developing and selling bifocal sunglasses.   SUNGLASSES WITH A "READING WINDOW‚Äù As we age, we begin to get long arms due to that we cannot focus on reading distance. In the 40-50 age range the focusing lens in the eye, the crystalline lens, tends to be less elastic. This means that the eye is less able to adjust to seeing at different distances. For a person with normal vision it will be harder to focus at close range while distance vision remains satisfactory. This natural change is called presbyopia and affects the 35% of humanity that are not users of regular glasses.  However, this can be corrected by using reading glasses or glasses with bifocal lenses. Our range of bifocal sunglasses contain reading lenses from +1,5 to +2,5. If you use +3,0 you can normally use +2,5 in sunglasses because you use them out in the sun and the sun is a quite strong light! With VISTALEC bifocal sunglasses you get all the features of high quality sunglasses together with a pair of reading glasses in the strength you need. Imagine when you are out in town and you get a message on your phone! Now you don¬¥t have to look for your reading glasses again. Only lower your eyes and read through the window in your strength! There are many other situations when VISTALEC reading sunglasses are really good to have.  For example, while reading in an outdoor setting, looking at the instrument panel when driving, paying parking tickets, reading your GPS and many, many more occasions!

Name: STRATO EYEWEAR
HQ Location: Italy, Veneto, Setteville, Via Zona Artigianale, 32038
Company description: We are high-quality eyewear manufacturers based in the province of Belluno, Italy.  STRATO is a small family-run company with over 30 years of experience in the manufacturing of eyewear collections made of different materials and through different manufacturing techniques. Indeed, what we're good at and our strength is the fact that we master many different techniques and this makes it easier for us to combine them as well. Our range of products goes from high-quality acetate frames, frames and components made of different metals and alloys (stainless steel, nickel silver, aluminum, brass, bronze), to combination frames and inlays in leather, wood, stone, etc. We also make injection-moulded frames or components which we also make the moulds for right inside our facilities. Another characteristic of our company is the ability of being flexible and dynamic, but still remaining well organized. We avoid outsourcing as much as possible, in order have a better hold of each step of the production and a better quality control on the final product. Quality indeed is our main goal and usually also the first thing our customers appreciate about working with us. They especially appreciate the fact that once the order is placed they are free to focus on other aspects of their job, because they trust us and know they're not going to have to spend their time doing another QC check after receiving their orders. We collaborate with the big brands and groups, and most of all we like to collaborate with the small, design- and quality-oriented independent brands that appreciate the quality of our products and trust our expertise for developing their concepts. Should you be interested in getting to know us better or for further information, please do not hesitate to get in contact with us.

Name: Ace & Tate

Name: Panetti Eyewear
Company description: In the heart of Italy, between Tuscany and Lazio, a family of craftsmen and cabinetmakers from 1753, before Napoleon, began is history and it was the nature that they found their inspiration in.  Throughout their lives, they have dedicated themselves to the care, seasoning, cutting of this fantastic raw material that is wood. Your glasses began to build in the 60s when skilled carpenter hands selected fine olive trees over 100 years old and then cut them into planks and stored them for over 40 years. The last step, and also the most satisfying, is the final processing, and their skilled carpenters' hands manage to convey the passion in any form. In the beginning it was the olive tree. Then the rosewood, then the ebony. Tomorrow it will be tea or coffee. The eyeglasses are manufactured starting from a single piece of solid wood to create the right curve, the temples are also curved for a better seal on the face. Each pair of glasses is unique for its age and irreproducible grain.  The veins make each pair of glasses different from one to another. The different types of wood, about 150, allow numerous possibilities of different colors and scents.  - Olivo It is a Mediterranean tree, symbol of life and perenniality; can live up to 3000 years.  - Rose wood Tree of tropical origins, it is best known as Palissandro. The innumerable nuances of red, pink and irregular veins make it special. Because of its rarity it has a high price  - Snake wood Endemic to Western Australia, it's so called for it's amazing snakeskin patterns and the wood is extremely dense  - Zebrano Originally from Gabon, the streaks are very different and go from black to brown. For this reason, each pair of glasses will be different and unique.  - Wenge It comes from the tropical forests of Africa. It is a compact, resistant and hard wood and is mainly used for the boxes and design furniture.

Name: Little Things Factory - A Brand Of PLANOPTIK AG

In addition to standardised products which are used as microstructured components in customer applications, the Little Things Factory offers individual systems solutions to suit customer requirements and a process controlling system which is indispensable as a flexible tool when working with a miniplant for process monitoring and optimisation.

Name: Hidden Disabilities Sunflower - Ireland
Company description: Wear the Sunflower Lanyard when you need additional support or a little more time Not all disabilities are visible ‚Äì some are not immediately obvious, such as autism, dementia, anxiety, visual or hearing impairment. People with visual or hearing disabilities do not always wear glasses or hearing aids. Those with joint problems or chronic pain may not always use mobility aids. Although the hidden disability can make daily living more challenging for many people, it can be difficult for others to recognise or acknowledge. Others may not understand the cause of the problem, if they cannot see evidence of it in a visible way. The Sunflower Lanyard makes you visible If you have hidden disabilities and require assistance, wearing the green Hidden Disabilities Sunflower Lanyard indicates that you need additional support or just a little more time. Our Sunflower Lanyard has been purposefully designed to acts as a discreet sign to staff and work colleagues that the wearer has a hidden disability and requires additional assistance. It has become the established symbol for hidden disabilities globally and has been successfully introduced to airports, supermarkets, railway stations and sports venues.

Name: Holobalance
Company description: The overall objective of HOLOBALANCE is to develop and validate a new personalized hologram coach platform for virtual coaching, motivation and empowerment of the ageing population with balance disorders.  The coaching part will be realised by holograms and augmented reality games, along with easy to use sensors (smart bracelet, smart glasses, sensorized soles) that can be customized to implement and coach the user with specific, individualized exercises, offering new forms of accessible user interaction. HOLOBALANCE will engage the experts related to the management of people suffering from balance disorders, including physiotherapists, Ear Nose Throat experts (ENTs), neurologists, psychologists, gerontologists, towards developing a multi-stakeholder user centered coaching ecosystem. Suggestions for specific exercises and tasks and an activity plan will be provided by the experts in a daily basis, which will be then refined and updated through autonomous learning algorithms. Three different types of coaching will be provided by the HOLOBALANCE platform: balance physiotherapy (BP),  cognitive training (CT) combined with auditory tasks  multilevel motivation and physical activity (PA) promotion. The platform will consist of a cloud based big data analytics component, with intelligent data mining algorithms, that will assess personalized heterogeneous data (motion capture sensor data, wearable sensor data, physiotherapy exercises movement data, clinical profiles), emotional and behavioural data (through emotional computing and behavioural modeling minimizing attention theft) and provide personalized advice, guidance and follow up for motivation, goal setting, BP, CT and PA. The accuracy in performance of the exercises will be measured objectively in real time, through a set of motion capture and wearable sensors. Experts will monitor the status through a visual analytics expert panel.

Through its commitment to innovation and personalized service, Schoonenberg is at the forefront of audiological care in the Netherlands.

Name: Audibene
Company description: audibene GmbH is the world's largest digital platform for hearing aids, providing over 1,000,000 consultations annually to support individuals with hearing loss. Founded in 2012 by Dr. Marco Vietor and Paul Crusius in Berlin, the company aims to shape the future of audiology through innovative digital solutions. Targeting primarily the Baby Boomer generation, many of whom are over 50 and often experience hearing issues, audibene addresses the gap where only a small percentage actually utilize hearing aids. The company operates a vast network of over 5,400 partner acousticians across eight countries, including Germany, the USA, and India, ensuring a seamless customer journey from initial consultation to hearing aid fitting.  Audibene's mission is clear: to ensure that everyone can hear well, leveraging a combination of cutting-edge technology and personalized advice to enhance the quality of life for its clients. The company emphasizes a customer-centric approach, offering a 28-day trial period for hearing aids to guarantee satisfaction before finalizing purchases. Additionally, by collaborating with health insurance providers, audibene helps clients navigate financial support for their hearing aids, making the process more accessible. With a commitment to modern technology and exceptional service, audibene empowers individuals to regain their hearing and improve their overall well-being, positioning itself as a leader in the hearing aid industry.

Name: OCULARIS
HQ Location: Spain, Catalonia, Sitges, Num.7 C/ Cam√≠ Del Coll, 08870
Company description: We are a non-profit NGO founded in 2010 in Barcelona by Dr. Joan Prat, head of Pediatric Ophthalmology at Sant Joan de De√∫ Hospital. Our action is certified by the AECID (Spanish Agency for International Development Cooperation) and by the IAPB (International Agency for the Prevention of Blindness). We combat blindness and visual impairment, especially in Sub-Saharan Africa. According to WHO data, 586 million people in the world suffer from visual impairments, which in 90% of cases are preventable or curable. In many African countries, people do not have access to the ophthalmological care they need due to the lack of specialized doctors: in Mozambique, there is 1 ophthalmologist for every million inhabitants. The consequences of this shortage of health professionals are considerable in the daily life, in the education, and in the economic development. Our team, made up of specialist surgeons in different branches of ophthalmology,  opticians-optometrists, ocular prosthetists and cooperative managers, focuses its activity on ophthalmological and optical training in Sub-Saharan Africa. What makes us different? Our action is focused on TRAINING, not on short-term assistance: we create postgraduate courses in COLLABORATION WITH LOCAL UNIVERSITIES, taking into account their needs and constraints. Our teachers travel on-site, allowing local doctors to train while curing their own patients, with their own tools: they will learn to diagnose, treat, operate and acquire the ability to teach their new generations of ocular health professionals without depending on outside help like ours. At present, we are developing and imparting training at the Faculty of Medicine of the Cheick Anta Di√¥p University (UCAD) of Dakar in SENEGAL, and at the Faculty of Health Sciences (FCS-UNILURIO) in Nampula, MOZAMBIQUE. We occasionally cooperate in urgent humanitarian aid missions, such as in refugee camps in Greece, and also collaborate with several social entities in Spain.

Name: Aspyro
Company description: We are Aspyro, a startup company that wants to improve happiness by developing innovatie medical devices. Our first product are the Oxy-glasses, 3D printed glasses for oxygen users. They solve multiple problems related to oxygen therapy that is used to treat patients with severe COPD, pulmonary fibrosis and other respiratory diseases.  Oxygen therapy makes the disease visible (e.g. COPD), thereby creating a stigma. Furthermore the nasal cannula leaves marks, causes irritation on ears and cheeks and easily slips out of the nose. Oxy-glasses are 3D printed glasses that have a groove inside the frame in which the nasal cannula can be inserted. This makes oxygen therapy barely invisble, reduces irritation and prevents the cannula from slipping out of the nose. The aim is that this stimulates patients to exercise more, have more social contacts and be more therapy compliant.  We serve our customers from our head office in Belgium. Visit our website www.aspyro.be for more information.

Name: Salvatore Ferragamo S.p.A.
Company description: Salvatore Ferragamo S.p.A. is the parent Company of the Salvatore Ferragamo Group, one of the world's leaders in the luxury industry and whose origins date back to 1927. The Group is active in the creation, production and sale of shoes, leather goods, apparel, silk products and other accessories. The Group's product offer also includes eyewear, fragrances and watches, manufactured by licensees. The uniqueness and exclusivity of our creations, along with the perfect blend of style, creativity and innovation enriched by the quality and superior craftsmanship of the 'Made in Italy' tradition, have always been the hallmarks of the Group's products. With approximately 3800 employees and a network of 389 directly operated stores as of 31 December 2022, the Ferragamo Group operates in Italy and worldwide through companies that allow it to be a leader in the European, American and Asian markets.

Name: DOLCE&GABBANA
Company description: Dolce&Gabbana, founded in 1985 by designers Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana, is a prestigious Italian luxury fashion house celebrated for its innovative and bold designs that reflect Mediterranean culture and craftsmanship. The company specializes in a diverse range of high-end products, including clothing, leather goods, footwear, accessories, watches, fragrances, and fine jewelry, catering to men, women, and children. With a mission to embody the essence of Italian artistry and luxury, Dolce&Gabbana aims to create products that resonate with a sense of heritage, individuality, and sophistication. The brand's vision emphasizes a blend of traditional craftsmanship with contemporary aesthetics, ensuring that each collection showcases a harmonious balance of elegance and character. Dolce&Gabbana's clientele includes fashion-forward individuals and affluent consumers who appreciate luxury, exclusivity, and exquisite craftsmanship. The company engages in partnerships with select licensees for eyewear and beauty products, enhancing its offerings and maintaining its status as a leader in the luxury market. Dolce&Gabbana is also committed to sustainability and social responsibility, striving to preserve Italian craftsmanship while engaging with local communities. The brand's recent initiatives, such as a popup boutique at Forte Village in Sardinia, exemplify its dedication to providing exclusive experiences that showcase its latest collections in elegant settings. Through its innovative designs and cultural narratives, Dolce&Gabbana continues to inspire and empower its customers, solidifying its position as a prominent name in the global fashion industry.

Name: Val Saint Lambert
Company description: The crystal company Val Saint Lambert was founded in 1826 and is the first Belgian company specialized in the production of various articles in crystal. Till 1970 Val Saint Lambert was the largest manufacturer of crystal in the world, they made glasses for the Tsars of Russia, chandeliers for the Maharajas in India and they also manufactured bathroom articles for the Orient Express.  After a few decades of silence the company has been taken over by Georges Forrest in 2018. Val Saint Lambert is re-launching and repositioning the offer by focusing on product development, production capacity and international sales plan. The production remains in Belgium and is still completely made by hand. The production range consists of the classical range, the result of nearly 2 centuries of heritage and of a new more modern line, that while bring more contemporary still pay tribute to the brand‚Äôs DNA. On the other hand a new line, more modern with the characteristics of the classical line as are our color and cutting (like the Kaleido collection). VAL SAINT LAMBERT is proud to be Official Supplier to H.M. the King of Belgium.

Name: Movitra Milano
HQ Location: Italy, Lombardy, Milan, 4 Via Francesco Cherubini, 20145
Company description: "We started from a common, simple need: the need to protect glasses from knocks and scratches. It all began with a friend at the beach. As she bent over to pick up her child, her glasses fell to the ground and, as often happens, they landed with the lenses facing down, which scratched them irreparably. That got us thinking: "We need a simple, practical system for protecting lenses". It was essential that it be something practical and simple, something that can be done in two movements, just like when you fold a normal pair of glasses. From there we began thinking about how to do it and we came up with Movitra."

Name: COY
Company description: COY Eyewear is the established marketplace for independent and designer sunglasses, uniting curated global brands with editorial insight.

Name: De Rigo
Company description: We are a multinational family business with a fascinating story - one worth telling and sharing. Founded in 1978 by the De Rigo family as a small artisan company in the Belluno area, today we are among the world leaders in the design, production and distribution of high-end prescription frames and sunglasses. Our Group is currently active in over 100 countries thanks to our extensive wholesale and retail network, with 24 subsidiaries, 100 independent distributors and 4 retail divisions: General Optica (Spain), Mais Optica (Portugal), Opmar Optik (Turkey) and affiliate Boots Opticians (UK). The decades of experience allows production standards of high quality and precision for the creation of sober and elegant jewels, linked to tradition but at the same time innovative. Thanks to this knowledge in the goldsmith field, in 2005 the company began the production, even customized, of semi-finished fashion accessories and currently collaborates with important names in the fashion and eyewear sector. The products are marketed through the network of traditional wholesalers, large-scale distribution and television net-works and are distributed in the American, European and Asian markets. The Mazzaretto Company combines competence, design and attention to the smallest details, characteristics that have made ‚ÄúMade in Italy‚Äù famous all over the world.

Name: Maison Degand

Name: ACI Industriearmaturen GmbH
Company description: ACI Industriearmaturen GmbH is an owner-managed company that has been in existence since 2008 and has its origins in the trade of industrial valves of all types and designs. Over the years, however, our company has specialised in the development, design and manufacture of vessel sight glass and flow sight glass fittings.  The focus here is on process monitoring of gaseous and liquid media such as steam, condensate, (drinking) water or chemicals. Whether flow sight glasses, weld-in or weld-on sight glasses, screw-on sight glasses or level indicators - we have a solution for almost every application. For us, the individual requirements of the customer are clearly in the foreground: We not only provide our process monitoring valves for your project, we also supply you with the required system components such as shut-off valves, control valves, backflow preventers, fittings and flanges, seals, screws and pneumatic, electric or hydraulic drives.  In the manufacture of our products, we use only the highest quality and certified primary materials, which consistently guarantee usability in pressure-bearing vessels and systems.

Name: NANOVAL GmbH & Co. KG

Name: Grafotec Spray Systems GmbH
Company description: Grafotec has been active in the flat glass industry since 1983. Initially, a roller powder device was developed that applies separating agent to the glass sheet via a roller. In 1995 Grafotec further expanded the glass division and a liquid application device was presented to the market - the "LA-C-Protection". The device is used to apply liquids to float glass, especially anti-corrosion agents that protect against corrosion during transport or storage. In 2002 the "LA-C protection" was further modified. The "LA-Automotive" was created. Now this makes life considerably easier for the manufacturers of car glasses. The ‚ÄúLA-Automotive‚Äù can apply liquids that allow a separating agent to be placed between the glass pair to be bent so well that it not only prevents slipping, but also significantly improves the optical quality of the windshield. In mid-2002, a nozzle sprayer successfully passed the field test. This further development of the roller powder devices was the application of powder by controllable nozzles. The high level of interest for the AP series results from the flexible powder distribution. This allows the powder application to be flexibly adapted to a wide variety of glass widths. The result is a high cost saving of the separating agent and especially in connection with an extraction a clean working environment. Since the subject of quality is coming more and more into focus, electrostatics play an important role, Grafotec also supports its customers with questions and problems relating to this topic. Quality support is also provided with an automatic control of the release agent application by means of optical monitoring and the automatic correction of the powder application. Grafotec's aim is to respond to requests in order to provide each customer with a suitable system tailored to their needs and circumstances.

Name: DAAL Noise Control Systems AS
Company description: High levels of wind noise is a health and safety hazard for motorcycle riders. DAAL Noise Control Systems is a Norwegian start-up tech company founded in 2016 by acoustician and motorcyclist Dag Loe and physicist Sigmund Birkeland. DAAL is currently developing an active noise control system (ANC) for MC helmets. Our system dampens wind noise without interfering with important traffic noises like car horns and sirens.

Name: Ic! Berlin
Company description: Ic! Berlin is a renowned eyewear company that specializes in designing and manufacturing high-quality glasses and sunglasses, all crafted in Berlin. Name: Synsam Group
Company description: Synsam Group is a prominent lifestyle company in the Nordic region, specializing in optical retail and eye health since its inception in 1968. With nearly 600 stores across Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Iceland, and the Faroe Islands, Synsam operates under the brands Synsam and Profil Optik, offering a comprehensive range of eyewear products and services, including spectacles, sunglasses, and contact lenses. The company's mission is to provide exceptional service and sustainable solutions in eye health and fashion, while its vision is to become the most sustainable lifestyle company in the optical sector.  Synsam caters to a diverse clientele, from fashion-conscious individuals to those in need of essential eye care, supported by a robust online presence that facilitates product purchases, eye exam bookings, and subscription management. The company is dedicated to innovation, exemplified by its pioneering eyewear subscription service and a strong commitment to sustainability through initiatives like the Synsam Recycling Outlet. With approximately 4,000 employees and net sales of around SEK 6.7 billion, Synsam Group stands at the forefront of the Nordic optical retail market, continuously enhancing the customer experience through digitalization and innovative concepts. Additionally, Synsam actively promotes initiatives such as "Everyone Should See," which provides free glasses to children with visual impairments, reinforcing its commitment to accessibility in eye care. By integrating advanced technology and sustainable practices into its operations, Synsam Group positions itself as a leader in the future of eye health, striving to ensure that good eyesight is accessible to everyone.

Name: POC
Company description: POC is a Swedish company dedicated to enhancing safety and performance for cyclists and athletes through innovative design and technology. Founded in Stockholm, POC's mission is to protect lives and reduce the consequences of accidents, offering a comprehensive range of cycling gear including helmets, eyewear, and protective clothing for men, women, and children. The company is known for its collaboration with professional cycling teams, notably EF Pro Cycling, to develop high-performance products that meet the rigorous demands of competitive racing. POC's target market includes both recreational and professional cyclists who prioritize safety, comfort, and cutting-edge technology in their gear. With a commitment to research and development, POC continually integrates advanced materials and features, such as MIPS rotational impact protection and VPD body protection, to ensure optimal performance and safety for all riders.

Name: Univet Optical Technologies

Experience the Univet difference today and see the world with clarity, precision, and uncompromising style.

Company description: Optical measuring and testing technology is our passion. Kitotec GmbH was founded in 2013 and started manufacturing and distributing KITOZOOM video microscopes. Name: VisionLab!

Name: Disop
Company description: Here at Disop, we have been developing formulas and manufacturing eye care and contact lenses care products for many years. Our journey began in the 1970s when the company‚Äôs founder, Javier Chamorro Tormo, travelled to England to learn about an invention that at the time seemed a thing of science fiction. This groundbreaking concept was a special lens that could be placed inside the eye to improve the wearer‚Äôs eyesight ‚Äì what we now know as contact lenses. Javier came back to Spain thrilled by this revolutionary idea and set out to visit optician after optician explaining the advantages it would bring and its potential to improve millions of lives. In the early years, the liquid required to keep those lenses in good condition had to be imported from abroad, making it costly and difficult to come by. This is what inspired Javier to set up his own liquid production factory: Disop. Javier‚Äôs son took over as manager in the 80s and the company grew to become a benchmark manufacturer on the Spanish eye care scene. Research by Disop Our laboratory develops new, innovative formulas for eye care and contact lenses care products. We work with state-of-the-art ingredients such as hyaluronic acid and have registered several patents. We recently added a new active agent to our catalogue -cannabidiol- , with which we have launched a new range of products and broadened our commercial activity to reach new markets. We also care about animal well-being, so we have developed a new pet product concept that is free from toxic substances, petrochemicals and fragrances. Manufacturing by Disop At our facilities in Alcobendas (Madrid), we produce our own brands in addition to manufacturing products for clients. Distribution by Disop As well as shipping across Spain, our products can be found in over 30 countries around the world.

Name: REALVISION GROUP
HQ Location: Italy, Lombardy, Sesto San Giovanni, 11 Via Oneda, 21018
Company description: Realvision Group deals with design, development and production of hardware and software for 3D glasses free vision in the fields of advertising, engineering, healthcare, optic and technical design.

Name: Syllucid
Company description: Syllucid is dedicated to producing fair, sustainable, and long-lasting electronic products. We started this company to give consumers responsible alternatives, to show the true cost of electronic products on the planet, and to work towards reforming our industry. We use our products as magnifying glasses on the electronics industry. By researching their supply chains they show us what challenges the industry is facing, what problems its supply chains cause, and how they can be solved.  We can‚Äôt change the industry alone or overnight, but we are steadily putting solutions into practice: Sustainable & fair materials We are dedicated to fairly and responsibly sourcing as many materials as possible and creating planet-centric supply chains for our products. This means using recycled and fairly sourced minerals and plastics and good working conditions along the entire supply chain. Durable Designs To make our and your products last as long as possible we're using innovative and durable design techniques to significantly prolong the lifespan of each product. The longer they last, the fewer we have to produce. Supply chain research and transparency We're using our products to make problems in electronics supply chains visible. We're using this knowledge to tackle systemic industry issues by creating partnerships with manufacturers, suppliers, customers, peers, NGOs, and governments. We partner up with researchers to find new ways how we can make value chains fairer and more sustainable. Creating holistically fair, sustainable and transparent supply chains will take a long time. But we think there is no time to waste. The sooner we start to address these problems, the better for all of us and our planet. That's why we're addressing this challenge head-on and are taking big steps forward with each batch we produce.

Name: Opticalrooms Ltd
Company description: OpticalRooms was set up in Dublin in 2012 to capture two trending markets - the amalgamation of medical professionals together under one roof in primary health care centres and - online purchasing of glasses, sunglasses and contact lenses. The large optical retailers have almost entirely captured the market and the emphasis is total devoted to sales. Sales = profit /dumbed down eye test fee. Time for a change, bring back the professional charge a fee for his expertise and a fair price for the frames and lenses. Working within GP surgeries, along side the other health care professionals we make every effort to bring great expertise and value to the centre. Ask any optometrist which is the most interesting part of the professional, most likely he will reply, increased learning and using his clinical knowledge. Ask him how he makes a living and he will have to take you out front, to view his frame range. Opticalrooms has a very low cost business model with none of the associated cost of renting and running a high street unit. We pass these savings on to our customers. In this way we can have a physical presence and compete with other online companies. I qualified as an Optometrist in 1990, a long time ago at this stage but rather than be entrenched in my ways I love change. The power of the internet has put this change in the hands of the public. The optical industry dreads the idea of people purchasing online or comparing prices. Personally I have no problem with this. We encourage people to purchase online and after they attend any of our clinics we upload their optical details, in full! to an online account where they have everything they need to order from us or anywhere on the web. Each clinic is fully stocked with frames, sunglasses and contact lenses and not every patient wants to transact online. Our goal is to provide great professional service, convenience and value. Give us a call and try this liberating experience I think you will be impressed.

Name: Vibrosonic GmbH
Company description: Founded in 2016, Vibrosonic GmbH is a pioneer in the field of medical technology focused on providing people with hearing impairment a close-to-normal hearing experience.  Our core invention, the Vibrosonic Hearing Contact Lens¬Æ, is a micro-loudspeaker that is placed directly onto the eardrum, thereby stimulating the natural hearing process. The result is a broad sound spectrum, covering high frequencies for speech comprehension and low frequencies for a striking experience when listening to music for example. Our objective is to develop the first invisible hearing aid based on our core technology.  The Hearing Contact Lens is the result of a research project between the University Hospital T√ºbingen, the Fraunhofer IPA, and other partners, originally directed at the development of an implant. Researchers and later founders of Vibrosonic found out that the Hearing Contact Lens can also be applied to non-implantable hearing solutions.

Name: Euthymiades Audiology Centres
Company description: Euthymiades Audiology Centres Ltd is a pioneer private company in the world of hearing impairment in Cyprus. The history of EAC LTD goes back to 1899 when Zenon J. Euthymiades founded the general commerce company Z.J. Euthymiades & Co Ltd. In the course of the years, the changing needs of the society and the advancement of hearing aid technology has changed the directions of this company. In 1949, the need of hearing aids in Cyprus and the intent to help hearing impaired people was the primary reason for ZJE & Co LTD to begin the import of Hearing Aids. The growing realisation of the necessity of these hearing instruments made it essential for the company to invest time, energy and money in developing. A completely separate company, under the name of Euthymiades Audiology Centres Ltd was established. A Century later, EAC LTD is housed in their own premises with the headquarters in the centre of the capital city of Nicosia and with branches in Limassol, Larnaca, Astromeritis and Paphos. EAC LTD is recognised as one of the leading Audiological Centres in the Mediterranean. The most advanced, up-to-date technology is used in the manufacture and after care of hearing instruments. Assembling hearing aids of all kinds but particularly ITC, ITE, and CIC aids, has made the company known world-wide. Present President of the company is Mr. Zenon J. Euthymiades, the grandson of the founder. Our clinical audiologists Mrs Athena Euthymiades, Mr Michael Euthymiades and Mrs Alexia Euthymiades together with other professionals, technicians and experienced staff make EUTHYMIADES AUDIOLOGY CENTRES LTD., the leading hearing health care centre in Cyprus.

Solutions that help people with hearing loss live life the way they want to. ¬† The Sound Experience Because we recognise how essential expert care is, we focus on putting our high-quality hearing aids in the hands of high-quality hearing care professionals ‚Äì those who are as committed to the highest standards as we are. And we consistently listen in order to meet their needs and understand their challenges, so they can provide the best experiences and results for each and every one of their clients. That‚Äôs what we call The Sound Experience ¬† The strength of a hearing care powerhouse Bernafon has been developing hearing aids since 1946, when a telephone company expanded its business to also develop amplification devices. The company was located in Bern, Switzerland, which led to the name Bernafon. By 1987, Bernafon was actually the first to develop a digitally programmable hearing aid ‚Äì and the first fully digital device came out in 1999. Bernafon was acquired by the Demant Group in 1994. Much of the company remained in Switzerland until 2022, when it then moved to the Demant Headquarters near Copenhagen, Denmark. ¬† As part of the Demant Group, with over a century of experience and know-how, Bernafon benefits from one of the world‚Äôs strongest hearing healthcare research and development teams, ranging from diagnostics to sound processing. We bring this strong foundation, expertise, and dedication to hearing care professionals ‚Äì so they can provide an exceptional sound experience.

Name: Alsoka Medical
Company description: The Vorotek O Scope is a head-worn microscope with bright LED lighting. The uniqueness of the O Scope is that it brings your pupils together (reduces your IPD) in such a way that you can look with both eyes into narrow cavities with sharpness and depth. It is a great innovation for the ENT specialist, the audiologist and General Practitioner alike. ENT specialists describe it as an essential complement to the capital intensive and immobile operating microscope. And audiologists as an extension to their toolkit allowing them to perform procedures not possible with loupe glasses. The area in which the O Scope offers sharp vision is about 10 cm long (compared with the operation microscope which has appr. 2 cm). The advantages summarised: - Flexibility: ENT treatments no longer depend on the fixed location of the surgical microscope - Ease of treatment: in case of patients with difficulty sitting still such as children or in case of patients who are bedridden - Speed of treatment: it takes less significantly less time as it does not require time to set up the patient - Productivity and better use of specialist time: possibility to have lower skilled staff perform the simpler treatments and to take treatments outside of the clinic - Work out of clinic closer to the patient: think of 1.5 clinic concept (performing ENT specialist procedures outside clinic in care homes or GP offices / outside clinic work) - Less capital required: the O Scope is only a fraction of the cost compared with an operating microscope In Australia has been the standard of care for ENT specialists for years now and 95% of ENT doctors and a majority of audiologists use the O Scope. In the US and the UK, the O Scope has been introduced in recent years and is increasingly finding a place next to the operation microscope and magnifying glasses.  Within the EU and wider continental Europe we have just started onboarding the first ENT surgeons, audiologists and GP centers.

Company description: Auri is a private provider of hearing aids. The company is built around the idea that people with hearing loss should be able to skip the long waiting lists in the public system, without paying anything and without having to compromise on quality. By combining sensible purchases with a rationalization of expenditure, which will be fully covered by government subsidy,  Auri has managed to create a business where it is possible to offer free hearing aids and high-quality treatment without delay.  Auri has within a short time become the leader for a substantial part of the private market in Denmark. The company currently consists of approximately 80 employees and has 26 clinics. The clinics have consultation by appointment, and clinic staff consists of a trained hearing specialist and a secretary. At the first visit to the clinic the patient will have a thorough hearing test and a conversation with a hearing specialist about which hearing aid solution that will fit best for the patient's needs and desires. Three weeks later the hearing aids is handed out and fitted in the clinic, where all subsequent adjustments also is made. Auri offer full warranty and an unlimited number of adjustments in the four-year subsidy period. All administration of the clinics is centralized in the headquarters of Auri in Slagelse, where economy, HR, IT, marketing, purchasing, logistics and repairs are handled.

Name: ExSilent
Company description: ExSilent: the new generation in hearing aids ExSilent is a young company. Our goal is to eliminate the obstacles that often arise when considering auditive support or amplification support. In order to achieve this, we developed innovative solutions. This enables the ear to decide where the sound is coming from thus the sound perception deviates less compared to using traditional (without MaRiC technology) personal sound amplifiers or hearing aids. Our business model is based on shared success through involvement in our network of independent, professional audiologists and dispensers. We strongly believe by working closely together, we can improve consumer acceptance and satisfaction. Name: Skulle Implants Oy
Company description: Skulle Implants was established in 2011 to commercialize innovations and research findings concerning bioactive glasses and the successful use of fiber-reinforced composites in dentistry. Fundamental research of bioactive glasses was carried out at the University of Turku and √Öbo Akademi University in Finland already in the 1980s. Following the intensive composite material research at the Institute of Dentistry, University of Turku in the late 1990s, the introduction of dental fiber-reinforced composites for clinical and commercial use created a solid foundation for a completely new type of bone surgery implants based on the GLACE‚Ñ¢ technology. The technology and unique production of implants combine the benefits of durable and imaging-compatible fiber-reinforced composites and the bone forming capability of bioactive glasses. As a result, medical implantology has shifted from metal-containing implants to novel high-tech composite implants of individual anatomic design and contour. GLACE‚Ñ¢ ‚Äì Good to the bone The active innovation and patenting policy resulted in the establishment of Skulle Implants. Globally, it is the only Class III (European Medical Device Regulation) medical device producing company that focuses on the production of unique custom-made bioactive glass fiber composite implants for bone repair and replacement. In 2014, the company launched its new production facilities in Turku and received accreditation for starting the production of custom-made implants. Skulle Implants aims to expand the clinical indications of GLACE‚Ñ¢ platform technology in close collaboration with clinical experts and material scientists.

De uitslag hiervan is binnen uiterlijk 3 werkdagen, en soms al dezelfde dag, in het bezit van uw opticien. Het uiteindelijke rapport ontvangt u vervolgens van uw eigen opticien, inclusief foto's en scans van uw ogen!
